TEXT: The applicant , Mr PERSON , is a NORP national , who was born in DATE and is currently imprisoned in GPE . He was represented before the Court by PERSON PERSON , a lawyer practising in PERSON . The respondent Government were represented by Mr P. A. GPE , the representative of GPE at ORG .
The facts of the case , as submitted by the parties , may be summarised as follows .

On DATE the police instituted criminal proceedings in connection with a theft of horses committed the night before . The police allegedly had information about the applicant 's belonging to the crime and CARDINAL of the thieves being at his home . At TIME on DATE QUANTITY police officers came to the applicant 's house in GPE . They entered his property through a gate and a front door which were unlocked . CARDINAL of them produced their service identification cards to the applicant 's sister who was in a kitchen . The applicant was not at home . CARDINAL police officer left the house while the other CARDINAL decided to remain inside and await the applicant 's return . Some time later the applicant arrived . CARDINAL of the policemen produced his service identity card . As the applicant had doubts about the lawfulness of their visit he sent his sister to call the police . Then a quarrel and a fight ensued between the applicant , who was supported by his relatives , and the CARDINAL policemen . A squad of police officers arrived soon afterwards . The police left the applicant 's home TIME at an unspecified time .

Early in the morning of DATE the applicant was arrested pursuant to LAW as a suspect on a count of horses ' theft and escorted to the police station . On DATE the applicant was detained on remand pursuant to LAW .
According to the applicant , on DATE he was beaten up by police officers who tried to force him to confess .

As the CARDINAL other suspects changed subsequently their original statements and testified that the applicant had not participated in the crime , in the absence of any other evidence , the police discontinued the criminal proceedings against the applicant and released him on DATE .

On DATE , at TIME , the applicant was examined in the PERSON traumatology centre . According to their certificate of DATE , the applicant had a closed head injury , concussion , a broken nose and bruises on his chest and waist . The applicant was forwarded for a further examination and an in - patient treatment to the PERSON hospital where he underwent treatment from CARDINAL to DATE . The hospital 's certificate of CARDINAL DATE confirmed the applicant 's diagnosis of a closed head injury and concussion .

On an unspecified date in DATE the applicant lodged a request with ORG to investigate the incident of DATE and his beating by police officers during his remand in custody from DATE . On DATE the regional prosecutor forwarded his application to ORG . After an inquiry into the applicant 's allegations ORG refused , on DATE , to institute criminal proceedings . Upon the applicant 's complaint to a higher prosecutor , on DATE , ORG upheld the district prosecutor 's decision .

On numerous occasions subsequently the applicant unsuccessfully lodged , with various levels of the prosecuting authorities , requests to reopen the investigation and institute criminal proceedings against the alleged perpetrators .

By a letter of DATE the regional prosecutor stated that the previous decisions of the prosecuting authorities were not to be reconsidered . The entry of the police into the applicant 's home was compatible with LAW and LAW . The investigation into the alleged ill - treatment was discontinued for the lack of evidence .

According to the Government , at some point ORG re - opened the investigation and following the additional inquiry into the applicant 's allegations again , on DATE , refused to institute criminal proceedings against the police officers having examined statements of witnesses and an expert opinion . The witnesses ( police officers , the applicant 's lawyer and CARDINAL other suspects in the proceedings concerning the theft of horses who saw the applicant at a confrontation DATE after the alleged ill - treatment ) did not confirm the applicant 's allegations . The expert questioned the applicant 's diagnosis of concussion and the fracture of nose , pointing out that medical documents did not specify supporting clinical data , and concluded that it was impossible to determine the time the injuries on the applicant 's face and waist had been caused .
According to the applicant , ORG did not examine his applications challenging the prosecutor 's refusal to institute criminal proceedings , which were lodged on DATE and DATE .

On DATE the ORG of Orel convicted the applicant of assaulting police officers on DATE . On DATE , upon the applicant 's appeal , the ORG quashed the judgment of DATE and remitted the case for a fresh examination at first instance , referring in this connection to the unlawful composition of the first instance court .
On DATE the applicant was convicted by ORG . He received a suspended sentence of DATE imprisonment . The sentence was revoked in view of an amnesty law .

Regarding the events of DATE , the court found that the police officers had arrived at the applicant 's home , acting in accordance with the law on police , in order to arrest a suspect and collect evidence about the applicant 's belonging to the crime . Upon the applicant 's arrival the police officers were attacked by the applicant and his relatives . As a result of assault one police officer sustained injuries to his arm , waist , nose and ear . The other policeman was diagnosed with concussion .
On DATE the ORG convicted the applicant of murder and robbery and sentenced him to DATE imprisonment .
